## Data Visualization packages to install
Install the GGally, ggpubr, and ggsignif packages
```{r pckgs, eval=FALSE}
install.packages(c("GGally", "ggpubr", "ggsignif", "viridis", "scales", "viridisLite", "survival", "survminer", "ggalluvial"))
library(GGally)
library(ggpubr)
library(ggsignif)
library(viridis)
library(scales)
library(viridisLite)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(ggalluvial)
```

## Anatomy of a ggplot figure {.centered}
```{r eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = <DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(
     mapping = aes(<MAPPINGS>),
     stat = <STAT>, 
     position = <POSITION>
  ) +
  <COORDINATE_FUNCTION> +
  <FACET_FUNCTION>
```

## Lets build a basic ggplot figure {.smallcode}
Add some statistics
```{r basicFig5.1, eval=FALSE}
iris |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_violin(trim = FALSE) +

              y_position = c(7.8, 8.5, 9),

```

## Lets build a basic ggplot figure {.smallcode}
Now we'll removed the violin plot legend, change the color palette, labels
```{r basicFig7.1, eval=FALSE}
iris |> 
  mutate(Species = factor(Species, levels = c("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), 
                          labels = c("Setosa", "Versicolor", "Virginica"))) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_violin(aes(color = Species), trim = FALSE, show.legend = FALSE) + 
  geom_jitter(aes(fill = Petal.Length), shape = 21, size = 3, alpha = 0.8) + 
  geom_signif(comparisons = list(c("Setosa", "Versicolor"), 
                                 c("Versicolor", "Virginica"), 
                                 c("Setosa", "Virginica")), 
              map_signif_level = T, 
              y_position = c(7.8, 8.5, 9), 
              tip_length = 0) +
  scale_fill_viridis(name = "Petal length") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("setosa" = "#06d6a0", "versicolor" = "#118ab2", 
                                "virginica" = "#073b4c")) +
  ylab("Sepal length") + 
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
        axis.text.x = element_text(face = "italic"))
```

## Basic figures: Survival plot<footnote>Code from <https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/Models.html#survival-plots></footnote> {.smallcode}
``` {r survivalPlot, eval=FALSE}
data(lung)
sfit <- survfit(Surv(time, status) ~  sex, data=lung)
ggsurvplot(sfit, 
           conf.int=TRUE, 
           pval=TRUE,
           legend.labs=c("Male", "Female"), 
           legend.title="Sex",  
           palette=c("cornflowerblue", "indianred3"), 
           title="Kaplan-Meier Curve for lung cancer survival",
           xlab = "Time (days)")
```

## Basic figures: Biplot<footnote>Code from <https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/Other.html#biplots></footnote> {.smaller}
```{r Biplot, eval=FALSE}
# fit a principal components model
fit <- prcomp(x = mtcars, 
              center = TRUE, 
              scale = TRUE)

# plot the results
library(factoextra)
fviz_pca(fit, 
         repel = TRUE, 
         labelsize = 3) + 
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "Biplot of mtcars data")
```

## Basic figures: Alluvial diagrams<footnote>Code from <https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/Other.html#alluvial-diagrams></footnote> {.smaller}
```{r alluvial}
# Quick data wrangling
mtcars_table <- mtcars %>%
  mutate(am = factor(am, labels = c("Auto", "Man")),
         cyl = factor(cyl),
         gear = factor(gear),
         carb = factor(carb)) %>%
  group_by(cyl, gear, carb, am) %>%
  count()
```
  

## Basic figures: Alluvial diagrams<footnote>Code from <https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/Other.html#alluvial-diagrams></footnote> {.smaller}
```{r alluvial2, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(mtcars_table,
       aes(axis1 = carb,
           axis2 = cyl,
           axis3 = gear,
           axis4 = am,
           y = n)) +
  geom_alluvium(aes(fill = carb), color="black") +
  geom_stratum(alpha=.8) +
  geom_text(stat = "stratum", 
            aes(label = after_stat(stratum))) + 
  scale_x_discrete(limits = c("Carburetors", "Cylinders", 
                              "Gears", "Transmission"),
                   expand = c(.1, .1)) +
  # scale_fill_brewer(palette="Paired") +
  labs(title = "Mtcars data",
       subtitle = "stratified by carb, cyl, gear, and am",
       y = "Frequency") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") 
```

## Basic figures: Interactive maps<footnote>Code from <https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/Maps.html#geocoding></footnote> {.smaller}
```{r maps, eval=FALSE}       
library(ggmap)
library(mapview)
library(sf)

# subset the data
homicide <- filter(crime, offense == "murder") %>%
  select(date, offense, address, lon, lat)
# view data

mapview(mymap)
```

## Basic figures: Dot chart<footnote>Code from <http://www.sthda.com/english/articles/24-ggpubr-publication-ready-plots/#google_vignette></footnote> {.smallcode}
```{r dotChart}
dfm <- mtcars
# Some wrangling
dfm = dfm |> 
        mutate(cyl = as.factor(cyl), 
               mpg_z = (mpg - mean(mpg))/sd(mpg),
               mpg_grp = factor(ifelse(mpg_z < 0, "low", "high"), 
                                levels = c("low", "high"))) |> 
        rownames_to_column(var = "name")
# Convert the cyl variable to a factor
dfm$cyl <- as.factor(dfm$cyl)
# Add the name colums
dfm$name <- rownames(dfm)
# Calculate the z-score of the mpg data
dfm$mpg_z <- (dfm$mpg -mean(dfm$mpg))/sd(dfm$mpg)
dfm$mpg_grp <- factor(ifelse(dfm$mpg_z < 0, "low", "high"), 
                     levels = c("low", "high"))
```


## Basic figures: Dot chart<footnote>Code from <http://www.sthda.com/english/articles/24-ggpubr-publication-ready-plots/#google_vignette></footnote> {.smallcode}
```{r dotChart2, eval=FALSE}
ggdotchart(dfm, x = "name", y = "mpg_z",
           color = "cyl",                                # Color by groups
           palette = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"), # Custom color palette
           sorting = "descending",                       # Sort value in descending order
           add = "segments",                             # Add segments from y = 0 to dots
           add.params = list(color = "lightgray", size = 2), # Change segment color and size
           group = "cyl",                                # Order by groups
           dot.size = 6,                                 # Large dot size
           label = round(dfm$mpg_z,1),                        # Add mpg values as dot labels
           font.label = list(color = "white", size = 9, 
                             vjust = 0.5),               # Adjust label parameters
           ggtheme = theme_pubr()                        # ggplot2 theme
           )+
           geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = 2, color = "lightgray")
```

## Basic figures: Faceted plot<footnote>Code from <http://www.sthda.com/english/articles/24-ggpubr-publication-ready-plots/83-create-and-customize-multi-panel-ggplots-easy-guide-to-facet/></footnote> {.smaller}
```{r facetedPlot, eval=FALSE}
df = ToothGrowth |> 
  mutate(dose = as.factor(dose))
p <- ggdensity(df, x = "len", fill = "dose", 
               palette = "jco", 
               ggtheme = theme_light(), legend = "top")
facet(p, facet.by = c("supp", "dose"),
       panel.labs = list(
         supp = c("Orange Juice", "Vitamin C"),
         dose = c("D0.5", "D1", "D2")
         ),
       panel.labs.background = list(color = "steelblue", fill = "steelblue", size = 0.5),
       panel.labs.font = list(color = "white"),
       panel.labs.font.x = list(angle = 45, color = "white")
      )
```

## Revisiting our basic ggplot figure build {.centered}
Let's write a function that makes this visualization for us
```{r basicFigAgain, echo=FALSE}
iris |> 
  mutate(Species = factor(Species, levels = c("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), 
                          labels = c("Setosa", "Versicolor", "Virginica"))) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_violin(aes(color = Species), trim = FALSE, show.legend = FALSE) + 
  geom_jitter(aes(fill = Petal.Length), shape = 21, size = 3, alpha = 0.8) + 
  geom_signif(comparisons = list(c("Setosa", "Versicolor"), 
                                 c("Versicolor", "Virginica"), 
                                 c("Setosa", "Virginica")), 
              map_signif_level = T, 
              y_position = c(7.8, 8.5, 9), 
              tip_length = 0) +
  scale_fill_viridis(name = "Petal length") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("setosa" = "#06d6a0", "versicolor" = "#118ab2", 
                                "virginica" = "#073b4c")) +
  ylab("Sepal length") + 
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
        axis.text.x = element_text(face = "italic"))
```



## Visualization function
What are the different parts?

* Data wrangling - factoring parameters of interest
* Mapping aesthetics
* Variables for fill and color
* List of comparisons for stats
* Heights for stats bars
* List of values for colors
* Name changes - what delimeter are we using



## Visualization function {.smallcode}
Data wrangling
```{r dataWrang, fig.height=2}
parameterFactoring = function(dataset, parameters, ...) {
  new_data = dataset
  for(param in parameters) {
    new_data = new_data |> 
      mutate(param = factor(get(param), ...))
  }
  return(new_data)
}
iris2 = parameterFactoring(iris, "Species", levels = c("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), 
                          labels = c("Setosa", "Versicolor", "Virginica"))
str(iris2)
```



## Visualization function {.smallcode}
``` {r figurePlot, fig.height=2}
baseFig = function(dataset, x_param, y_param, z_param = NULL, color_list, ...) {
  p = dataset |> 
        ggplot(aes(x = get(x_param), y = get(y_param))) +
        geom_violin(aes(color = get(x_param), trim = FALSE, show.legend = FALSE)) +
        scale_color_manual(values = color_list)
  return(p)
}
f2 = baseFig(dataset = iris2, x_param = "param", y_param = "Sepal.Length", z_param = "Petal.Length", 
       color_list = c("setosa" = "#06d6a0", "versicolor" = "#118ab2", 
                                "virginica" = "#073b4c"))
f2
```



## Visualization function {.smallcode}
``` {r dataLayer, fig.height=2}
pointsOverlay = function(plot, z_param = NULL, ...) {
  if(!is.null(z_param)) {
    p = plot + geom_jitter(aes(fill = get(z_param)), ...) + 
      scale_fill_viridis(name = gsub("\\.", " ", z_param))
  } else {
    p = plot + geom_jitter(...)
  }
  return(p)
}
f3 = pointsOverlay(plot = f2, z_param = "Petal.Length", shape = 21, size = 3, alpha = 0.8)
f3
```



## Visualization function {.smallcode}
``` {r addStats, fig.height=2}
addStats = function(plot, dataset, comparisons) {
  minY = max(layer_scales(plot)$y$range$range)
  yPositions = rep(minY, 3) + c(0.3, 0.6, 0.9)
  p = plot + 
    geom_signif(comparisons = comparisons, 
                map_signif_level = TRUE, 
                y_position = yPositions, 
                tip_length = 0)
}

f4 = addStats(plot = f3, dataset = iris2, comparisons = list(c("Setosa", "Versicolor"), 
                                 c("Versicolor", "Virginica"), 
                                 c("Setosa", "Virginica")))
f4
```
